data.title: Discussions on R.Madhavan
data.text:
PROUDEST DAY AS AN R MADHAVAN FAN

message from maddy yahoo fan group

Ok , it's 2 AM out here and i ve gathered all my energy spirits

together to come up with a summary of my thoughts before hitting the

bed and concluding what would be one of the proudest days in my life

as a cinema fanatic , tamil cinema fanatic and most importantly ,

Maddy fanatic !

Yes , i guess you all should be knowing me very well by now ! I don't

av a good name out here , very harsh critic i suppose and what not . I

will take all that you can give bout me because all of that got

converted today into emotion , respect and pride for R.Madhavan and

his mercurial brilliance .

I luckily got the ticket for the premieres of Evano Oruvan and despite

all protests in my house for it being a night show , i made it to the

movie and sat all by myself .

I will describe the movie in short for you people as im sure you are

all gonna watch it and know bout it yourself .

It's one of the best PARALLEL CINEMA EVER MADE IN TAMIL CINEMA !

You cannot compare it with a commercial cinema and with MIDDLE CINEMA

. This is more along the international film making pattern of story

telling and movie making and Evano Oruvan ranks with cult movies like

Kurudhipunal , Veedu etc ..

The movie brings out the inner demon inside us and puts him to shame

while it also brings out the fiery social hero inside and asks him to

WAKE UP AND SMELL THE COFFEE !

Story Wise , im gonna reveal nothing ! Screenplay wise , it's awesome

as the movie is basically what happens in a man's life in about 2

day's time ! JUST 2 days and the world turns upside down for him . I'm

not supposed to be saying this but i almost cried today for the way

Maddy struggled in the movie as Sreedhar Vasudevan . It made me feel

so hurt and passionate . All my criticisms of Maddy the " Star " kept

flying out of my mind as every scene went by as it was like Maddy made

me eat humble pie again and again . Ivaraya da criticize panine nu

sollara nelamaiku ennoda Conscience vanthuduchu ! I'm not taking by

what i ve said in this place in the past but at the same time , i

would be the most happiest person to eat humble pie . It's like a

teacher student relationship . The harshest teacher is the most

happiest when the student comes out with flying colours . The teacher

was harsh in the first place because she cared so much bout the

student n had to take some stick for it from all angles when she

accepted to take this kid into her stride . So what better than a

centum score in the board exams for her loved ones !!

Anyways , i dunno if this movie is going to plant a change in the

society or not . Even if it does , it will only be temporary as we are

in a monotonous system where we will eventually revert back to the old

practises to which we are exposed more . So im sure Maddy's is not

counting on social changes . But i know that with every palm aching

clap of mine , i made 10 ppl around me clap during the movie's

scintillating scenes and made them FEEL RESPONSIBLE and associated

with this movie .

Evano Oruvan is a parallel cinema that is taking Tamil Cinema to WORLD

CLASS STANDARDS ! The direction was outstanding , how on earth did

NISHIKANTH MANAGE TO DO THIS WITHOUT KNOWING THE LANGUAGE ? IM AMAZED !

The dialogs by Maddy - easily matched Mani Sir's standards and im a

Mani Sir fanatic as well , so you can guess the level to which Maddy's

dialogs impressed and inspired me .

Acting of Seeman was inspirational because he made me respect the

POLICE SHIRT again . Class !! Simply Class . Never knew he was such a

great talent . Maddy was right bout him ! Sangeetha - she outclassed

her performance in Pithamagan . SUch an irritating character she had

got but she made us watch it with so much ease and thrill . I almost

started choking during a penultimate scene of hers with Maddy !

and hey , what do you say about our man R.Madhavan ! His performance

in this movie was the reason i ve been waging wars with every tom and

dicky and harry for all these years now . This is what i wanted as i

was fighting a lost cause so far and had lost all my weaponry . Evano

Oruvan just gave me a Bazooka ... Sreedar Vasudevan is R.Madhavan's

BEST PERFORMANCE EVER ! And one of tamil cinema's greatest

performances ever . Easily . I was the last person to leave the

theatre hall and it was so emotional and inspirational for me . I felt

like i had a dose of courage , strength and pride instilled in me all

of a sudden and it was all down to Maddy's performance . An ingenious

performance of some sorts .

So the movie ended at around 12 30 and i waited outside , saw Ajith

and other stars leave . My poor brother was waiting for my to come and

then only lock the gates , so i called him and told him it's going to

take some time for me to come home as i wanna wait for maddy to come

out . So i waited in the really cold parking area of Satyam Theatres

and almost everybody left cos it was getting late . Only a few of us

were remaining and then Maddy came out ! Till then , i was reluctant

to go to meet the stars , i just watched from afar but when maddy came

, i felt like someone pushed me to go talk to him . I felt like

someone whispered to me - " Poda poi pesu da , it's your moment ! " ..

So i went , i waited for a old man to finish his words and then i

shaked hands with maddy n said - " Hi maddy , remember me ? " ..

Rightfully , Maddy smiled and said - " NO !! " .. he he

So i told him - " SA from the fan club !! ... "

Then his face kind of smiled and he said - " aah yes , sure do .. did

you like the movie ? how was it ? "

But by that time , i started to shiver ( it was already cold and

meeting maddy after any other normal movie wud not av given me this

nervousness ! But after this awesome movie , i had a million things to

say but it broke down as million fragments ! that means , i started

BLABBERING ! ha ha ) ...

" Yep , saw it maddy , it was oustanding ! Im proud .. i .. dunno ..

say .... what .. to ... blah blah " ...

I didnt want to make a fool out of myself cos i was literally tongue

tied and at the same time , kai kuduthathe pothum ( shaking hands was

enough ) , let maddy enjoy his glory nu i felt !!

So then , another man ( who was grumbling all that while about maddy

taking so much time to come out and kept showing off bout he ain't

gonna bother staying around blah blah !! ) interuppted my convo with

maddy ABRUPTLY and started speaking to Maddy like as if he was waiting

all this while with hope !! he he ... i gave him a weird look saying -

" ada paavi , enna laam scene potte maddy varathuku minnadi ! "

Then i went n spoke to Saritha as i ve never had the chance to speak

with her before and she was standing right next to these ppl and

thankfully , she was just looking on ! Introduced myself in an

embarassing way to her as i was sure she would know me for the

unpopular reasons more ( rightly so ! ) , so i pointed that out and

then she immediately recognized me ... lol .. She was very sweet

and she made me feel lil warm .. She asked me if i liked the movie and

i said something alone the lines of - " So proud .. today was wat i

was waiting for .. very proud to be .... " and i started choking after

that ! ... lol ... damn !!

But anyways , such is the charm of these scripts that , not everythin

takes place smoothly . It has its ebbs and it has its highs .. For the

joy i encountered in the last 5 hours , i don't mind not being able to

translate my feelings properly to Maddy n Saritha !! I can't ask for

more can i ? But hey , apparently , even if i don't want to ask ,

Maddy had the ICING on the cake cos after speaking to Saritha , i

wanted to leave maddy to enjoy his moment and not bug him much , so i

tried making a decent exit , taht time , Maddy himself said aloud

amidst being mobbed by ppl - " Hey ... BYE S.A " ...

That to me , Completed the year 2006, i don't care if there are 23

days more to go , for me , the year ends HERE with Maddy's gesture .

Period ! Mudinju POchu ! ennaku ithu pothum for the next decade !! ..

So then i left and reached home at 1 30 AM ! And first thing i did was

apologize to our member Santhy Nicholas as she asked me to tell Maddy

that she said HI ! But i was already frozen upstairs ( in my brain

that is ! ) and i totally forgot that ! So im very sorry Shanthy ..

If at all Maddy would be reading this , he will surely tell you that i

was not in the best position to think outside the box , when i met him

! he he ..

Thus came to an end , yet another wonderful chapter as a Maddy fan . I

know , it's not going to be like this always as his forth coming

movies are different and are not going to be of this level . But hey ,

kesara sara , Lets take things as they come , so for now , I'm gonna

be angelic as i really av no other choice after being flattered by the

angels themselves !!

Good night all , go watch Evano Oruvan and revitalize your Maddy

spirits ... Evano Oruvan is like our Graduation Day from college of

R Madhavan Arts and Entertainment !! SUms it up

Mahen wrote:

Maddy is a clown..HE has a weird script sense..For him, movies like rendu, priyasakhi,valtukal are brilliant scripts..He actually said priyasakhi was better than Alaipayuthey

Dhanya, GM is good director not great..He has his own style which makes him different from others..You said VV was pathetic, but it was the biggest hit in 2006..I like his outspokenness when commenting on actors in our industry...He exposes their true colors..Tamil cinema needs people like him to change the attitude of 'some' of the actors in kollywood...Imagine what will happen to tamil films if kollywood is filled with 'image - conscious' actors like Vijay, madhavan.?

Mahen, I definitely accept that Maddy's script sense(in Thamizh) is pathetic, which is what I've personally been telling all along!! But as for GM being a good director, I juz could not make myself to agree to it. I am well aware that VV was one of the biggest hits in 2006, but that hardly classifies him as a good director. Commercially successful movies do not exactly mean they are good movies!!! If that is so, even Thirupaachi or Sivakaasi can be called good movies!!!(No! Am not dumb enuff to compare those two movies. I was juz talking abt the commercial success=good movie part of it!!)

Why I say VV was pathetic bcoz GM hardly had a aim in the movie!!! Screenplay went totally awry in the second half not to mention the forced unconvincing climax!! (Given a chance he wud have killed off Jyo in this one too). It started of aa a serial killer movie and then went to be a cat-and-a-mouse race and spiraling around without purpose or aim. His movies are juz stylish. They lack substance. Even KK's first half was desultory coz of the Surya-Jyo romance as well.

And abt his outspokenness. I dun agree wid ya here as well. I feel he's juz nurturing to his hurt ego with his so-called frank interviews! When he spoke abt Bheema, he said he's open to discussion abt PMKC where he had made mistakes. And why exactly did he say that? B'coz 'twas a flop commercially. Had it become a hit, he would have conveniently ignored the fact that his movie and screenplay is indeed flawed and went on as if he makes spotless movies. And about actors' image. I think every single actor has their own image problem and you really cannot help it. If GM had a problem wid Vijay coz he wanted 'Sivakasi' like elements in his movies, then why on earth does he say there r few scenes incorporated for Surya's sake in Varanam Aaayiram coz he has an image amongst college gals?! Am sure Vijay is not all that hopeless as to suggest something like sivakasi from GM, but he does have a fan following and he wants to cater to them, which is quite understandable. If GM doesnt have a prob wid making compromises for Surya's sake(no denying he's a director's actor), he can as well make compromises for Vijay's sake. And as for Maddy rejecting PMKC, he was asked to play the role coz GM didnt want to waste Jyo's call sheet. That would hurt any actor's ego, forget Maddy!! I dun think there's one actor out there without an image problem. Its not juz the Vijays or Maddys of Thamizh cinema alone who have them.

All that said, ya r entitled to ur views. I juz dun concur wid ya, thats all.

Ps: I am not a Vijay fan.

PS 1: I am not Maddy fan either. I used to be, now i juz simply like him. But definitely not to the extent of defending him no matter what he says or does.

PS 2: I do not dislike GM. I juz despise his high strung attitude and the way he flaunts it at every single opportunity that comes his way.
